snippet: Kazuo Hirai said he would focus Sony’s resources away from its unprofitable television business and more toward mobile devices, cameras and games.
abstract: Sony chief executive Kazuo Hirai details company's turnaround plan, saying focus will shift resources away from the unprofitable television business and toward mobile devices, cameras and games; plan also includes cutting 10,000 jobs; Sony has had four consecutive years of losses, but has rapidly lost ground to other companies.

byline.original: By HIROKO TABUCHI and BETTINA WASSENER
byline.contributor: Bettina Wassener reported from Hong Kong.

lead_paragraph: Kazuo Hirai said he would focus Sony’s resources away from its unprofitable television business and more toward mobile devices, cameras and games.

headline.seo: Sony Unveils Plans to Revive Company
headline.main: Sony Chief Unveils Plans to Revive Company
headline.print_headline: Sony’s New Chief Lays Out a Plan for a Turnaround
